alert.note: Alert for Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 3:25PM EDT until August 16 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rains have ended. However, between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over this area from the earlier thunderstorms. This amount of water will take some time to drain away. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will remain in effect. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Palm Beach, Jupiter, Palm Beach Gardens, Riviera Beach, Tequesta, North Palm Beach, Lake Park, The Acreage, Fau North Campus, Limestone Creek, Jupiter Farms and Philo Farms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
